chargeHist.descr: Physical Abuse of Elder Person - Intentionally Cause Bodily Harm

result.execSummary:
The defendant Tessa Raelynn Marschner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Physical Abuse of Elder Person - Intentionally Cause Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.198(2)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Complete AODA and all treatment/counseling as necessary.

Maintain absolute sobriety.  No alcohol.  May not possess or consume any controlled substances unless prescribed by a medical professional.  May not enter any bars, taverns or establishments where the primary source of revenue is the sale of alcohol.

records.addlTxt: 3:25 PM Defendant Tessa Raelynn Marschner in court.  Attorney Kevin M Smith in court for Tessa Raelynn Marschner.  Attorney Richard Jay Sullivan in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant pleads guilty to Count 1; Court finds defendant guilty.  Defendant waives right to presentence investigation.  Court orders sentence withheld, 3 years probation, any treatment deemed necessary, AODA, maintain absolute sobriety, no alcohol, may not possess or consume any controlled substances unless prescribed by a medical professional, may not enter any bars, taverns or establishments where the primary source of revenue is the sale of alcohol, costs due to Clerk of Court, 2 days sentence credit.
Justice Point: Rock County Pretrial Supervision Report

Activity:  Waiver of preliminary hearing and arraingment  
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

01:17 PM Defendant Tessa Raelynn Marschner in court by phone with intern Olivia Long by video supervised by attorney Kevin M Smith by video.  Noah M Tylenda appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant waives preliminary hearing freely and voluntarily.  Court accepts waiver and binds the Defendant over for the filing of an Information.  Information filed, copy to Defendant, reading waived.    Defendant pleads not guilty and jury trial to be set.  Bond continued.

records.addlTxt: Justice Point: Rock County Pretrial Risk Report

Activity:  Initial appearance  
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

03:24 PM Defendant Tessa Raelynn Marschner in court in custody by video from the Rock County Jail with attorney Kevin M Smith by video.  Gerald Anthony Urbik appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Address verified. Court orders $500 Signature bond with conditions: No contact directly or indirectly with victim D.M., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere except for one time trip with law enforcement to retrieve personal belongings. Absolute sobriety. Court orders Level 2  supervision through JusticePoint.  Must contact JusticePoint within 24 hours of release from custody. Adjourned initial appearance scheduled June 1, 2022 at 1:00 PM.

No contact directly or indirectly with victim D.M., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. Absolute sobriety.   Court orders Level 2  supervision through JusticePoint.  Must contact JusticePoint within 24 hours of release from custody. 1 time visit with police to get belongings.
